cz.ive.location
Class WayPointImpl

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.messaging.SyncHook
      cz.ive.iveobject.IveIdImpl
          cz.ive.iveobject.IveObjectImpl
              cz.ive.location.WayPointImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IveId, IveObject, WayPoint, Hook, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CommonArea
public class WayPointImpl
extends IveObjectImpl
implements WayPoint

An implementation of WayPoit. WayPoint can be either valid or invalid. Valid WayPoint is a real IveObject registered in the ObjectMap. Invalid WayPoint is a copy of valid WayPoint used just to describe a position of a valid (may be not currently existing) WayPoint.

Author:
pavel
See Also:
Serialized Form

WayPointImpl

public WayPointImpl(java.lang.String objectId,
                    float[] realPosition)
Creates a new instance of empty (invalid) WayPointImpl. Does not take care of the kind, any path can go to it (the kind is set to null).

Parameters:
objectId - id of the WayPoint
realPosition - coordinates of the new WayPoint

                          Kind skind)
Description copied from interface: WayPoint
Determines whether the given kind matches the searched kind. The kinds match, if one of the two arrays is null, or at least one number equals in both arrays.

matchKinds in interface WayPoint
Parameters:

getNeighbours

public java.util.List<Joint> getNeighbours(Kind kind)
Description copied from interface: WayPoint
Getter for neighbours of this WayPoints with the given kind. These are instances of class WayPoint if they belongs to the same area and may be phantoms otherwise. There are two arrays of kinds, the given one and the neighbour's one. The neighbour is returned if one of the two arrays is null, or at least one number equals in both arrays.

Specified by:
getNeighbours in interface WayPoint
Returns:
joints to neighbours of the given kind of this WayPoint

findPlace

protected WayPoint findPlace(WayPoint where,
                             IveObject object,
                             WayPoint from,
                             WayPoint to)
Finds the WayPoint suitable to place the Object on. The WayPoint will be the most detailed existing child of the 'where' WayPoint, will have matching kind with the object and will be connected to the 'from' WayPoint (if 'from'is null, it won't be considered).

Parameters:
where - WayPoint in which we are searching
object - Object we want to place
from - WayPoint we are comming from, can be null
to - WayPoint we are comming to, can be null
Returns:
WayPoint to place the object on, null if no suitable WayPoint was found.

placeObject

public boolean placeObject(IveObject object,
                           WayPoint from,
                           WayPoint to)
Description copied from interface: WayPoint
Places an object to a WayPoint or it's child. The object will be placed to a most detailed existing waypoint, which is a child of this WayPoint, with respect to the WayPoint's kinds, the incoming direction and object places defined for expand.

Specified by:
placeObject in interface WayPoint
Parameters:
object - Object to be placed
from - WayPoint from which the object is comming. If it is null, the direction will not be considered. If it is not null, the object will be placed to some WayPoint which adjoins the 'from' WayPoint or any it's direct or indirect child. This means, if no joint exists between the childrens of this WayPoint and subtree of the 'from' WayPoint, the object cannot be placed.
to - WayPoint (maybe phantom) to which the object is comming
Returns:
true if the object was placed on some WayPoint; false if the object was not placed. The reason can be one of these: object cannot be placed to any WayPoint because of their kinds, no connection to the 'from' WayPoint was found, or their combination.

public Influence[] getInfluences()
Getter for LOD influences. This affects LOD level of target loactions if there is a holdback on this WayPoint.

buildSubtree

protected void buildSubtree(WayPoint wp,
                            LOD lod,
                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> set)
Recursively calling method to realize the getSubtree method. Recursively backtrakcs the tree of WayPoints to the depth and builds the set of their names.

Parameters:
wp - Root of the tree to backtrack
lod - Lod interval of the result
set - Incrementally builded result set

getSubtree

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSubtree(LOD lod)
Implements method from WayPoint interface. Runs up through the tree while it reaches the minimum of the given lod interval. From that point backtracks the tree to the maximum of the given lod interval and builds the set.

Specified by:
getSubtree in interface WayPoint
Parameters:
lod - The lod interval of the result
Returns:
Set of all names of accessible WayPoints

expand

public void expand()
            throws NoObjectPlaceException
Description copied from interface: WayPoint
Called when LOD of this WayPoint is being increased. An object may want to create some subobjects. Throws NoObjectPlaceException if cannot find a WayPoint to place some object.

Specified by:
expand in interface WayPoint
Throws:
NoObjectPlaceException
